translation: Who strive not high, sunk deep in sloth Ruin their house by evil growth
explanation: Family (greatness) will be destroyed, and faults will increase, in those men who give way to laziness, and put forth no dignified exertions
mk: சோம்பேறித்தனமானவர்களின் வாழ்க்கையில் குற்றங்களும் பெருகிவிடும்; குடும்பப் பெருமையும் சீரழிந்து போய்விடும்
mv: சோம்பலில் அகப்பட்டு சிறந்த முயற்சி இல்லாதவராய் வாழ்கின்றவர்க்கு குடியின் பெருமை அழிந்து குற்றம் பெருகும்.
sp: சோம்பலில் வீழ்வதால் சிறந்தவற்றையேச் செய்யும் முயற்சியே இல்லாதவரின் குடும்பமும் அழியும் குற்றமும் பெருகும்.
gptExplanation:
This verse from the Thirukkural emphasizes the detrimental effects of laziness and lack of effort. It states that when a person falls into the trap of idleness and refrains from making any constructive effort, it not only leads to the amplification of his/her faults but also brings down the prestige and honor of their family.

The verse is a strong reminder of the importance of hard work and diligence. In a cultural context, it resonates with the traditional Indian values that place a great emphasis on the respect and honor of the family. It cautions that apathy and lack of motivation not only harm the individual but also tarnish the family's reputation.

Furthermore, the verse implies that inactivity is a breeding ground for vices. When one doesn't engage in meaningful activities, it's easy to fall prey to negative habits or behaviors. Therefore, it encourages individuals to be diligent and active, as it not only enhances personal growth but also contributes to the overall well-being and honor of one's family. 

In essence, Thirukkural 604 is a call to action, urging individuals to shun laziness, strive for excellence, and uphold the honor of their family through their actions.
